script:
1). During the cold weather most of the people who come to the library just want to sit in a warm place.
Most people come to the library to find out information about what's happening locally.
Well, that's all right because the library is also a sort of refuge, isn't it? 
The problem with libraries is that you have to talk very quietly.
2). Do you think anyone can make a living out of simply writing books?
I suppose it depends on what sort of books you're writing. 
I met a woman the other day who was earning a fortune writing children's books.
Local councils are happy to encourage younger readers to come to the library.
3). Do you like going to second-hand bookshops?
There's a small town in the west of England that's full of second-hand bookshops.
Some bookshops sell really old books at ridiculous prices.
Not really. You never know who's owned them before you.
